properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy wet snow expected tonight through Monday morning. Snow mixed with rain this afternoon will change over to snow tonight then gradually tapering off on Monday morning. Highly localized total snowfall amounts up to 15 cm are possible by Monday morning. Untreated surfaces may become slippery. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T11:46:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-29T19:47:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4250981407.2020
Area: Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, White River - Dubreuilville, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls, Chapleau - Missinaibi Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy wet snow expected into the morning. Snow across the region will gradually tapering off this morning. Localized total snowfall amounts near 10 cm are possible by the middle of the morning. The snow may continue until the early afternoon between Timmins and the Quebec border. Untreated surfaces may become slippery. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T20:54:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-30T04:55:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2352818412.2020
Area: White River - Dubreuilville, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls, Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls, Chapleau - Missinaibi Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An additional 5 to 10 centimetres of snow is expected today. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T21:59:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-30T08:34:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1233635795.2020
Area: La Malbaie area, Baie-Saint-Paul area, Apica Mountain area, Grands-Jardins Park area, l'Étape area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system from United States will continue to affect the province of Quebec until Monday. Snowfall amounts of up to 15 centimetres are possible over Central Quebec. However, precipitation amounts could vary widely depending on the area as temperatures will be near the freezing mark. Some regions near and south of the St. Lawrence River could mainly see 5 to 10 centimetres of snow, while up to 15 centimetres may fall locally over higher terrain. Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult locally. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-30T17:45:45-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-30T01:46:45-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1785492947.2020
Area: Matawin - Mauricie National Park area, Lac-aux-Sables area, Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area, Thetford Mines area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm continues. A prolonged period of snowfall continues to impact communities in northern Manitoba today. Snow will be heavy at times and will accumulate quickly, with total amounts in the 15 to 25 cm range through tonight. While snow from this first system will gradually taper off later tonight, a second disturbance is expected to cross northwestern sections of the province Tuesday night into Wednesday, potentially bringing another 10 to 15 cm of snow to those areas. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-31T01:18:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-30T09:19:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3107640652.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, Lynn Lake, Leaf Rapids, Pukatawagan, Churchill
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Drizzle Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Areas of freezing drizzle are expected or occurring. Locations: Northern Avalon Peninsula, including St. John's and vicinity. Time span: continuing until this afternoon. Remarks: Freezing drizzle, occasionally mixed with snow or freezing rain, will continue until temperatures gradually rise above zero this afternoon ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing drizzle advisories are issued when drizzle falling in sub-zero temperatures is expected to freeze on contact, and over time create icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-30T20:05:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-30T07:44:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3401807011.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
